title: Completely Random Perma-Ban for Botting
body:
What's up guys?

Fist time post here, and not or a good reason.

After years of playing this game always on the same account i came back +/- a week ago with my cousin to grind some duo ranked games after a year break.

Yesterday I was playing as normal and just got message ingame saying my account was locked , went on my e-mail and I realised that I was getting banned for "botting" purposes.

So, answering the obvious questions, i don't use bots or anything like it, i don't share my account/account info or any 3rd party programs.

The only thing different on my account from a few days ago is the amount of games done per day, obviously, and a different pc/internet provider.

So I was wondering that anyone that has passed through the same situation could help me getting my account back by telling me what can i provide so that i can prove that I'm not actualy botting.

Thanks you guys!

replies.body: I mean you wouldn’t get banned for botting if you didn’t do that .. FACT. Either you’re not telling the full truth in order to look like you’re not in wrong OR you account shared and someone else used bots on your account.... so easy to lie on forums so without proof it’s your word against riots.. riot doesn’t care that much to just ban you for no reason so you must have botted . case closed!

Imagine unironically believing this.
False positives have been on the rise, the forums prove this. 

So either; this is bait, or an attempt to be edgy af.

It seems there was an error with the current wave of bot bans that caught a bunch of innocent players as well. I don't know the details but it looks like quite a few were reversed without even a ticket to player support (i.e with no action needed from the player affected). It's not great, but it's obviously been caught and is being handled.

That said, apparent configuration errors aside, 3rd party detection is still the most accurate and least likely to result in a false positive. This is an entirely different beast than the one that detects behavioural offences.

I just got it back. they said it was a false positive.

You were wrong, but thanks for your time tho.

>The only thing different on my account from a few days ago is the amount of games done per day, obviously, and a different pc/internet provider.

Your account was locked in case of account selling. Contact support.
